auto_tag.name: Description
auto_tag.value: Signals that the provider should automatically add a tag to all API calls denoting that the resource was created by Terraform

key.name: Description
key.value: API token used to authenticate with the Circonus API

active.name: Description
active.value: If the check is activate or disabled

dimmensions.name: Description
dimmensions.value: The dimensions to query for the metric

metric.name: Description
metric.value: One or more CloudWatch Metric attributes

namespace.name: Description
namespace.value: The namespace to pull telemetry from

url.name: Description
url.value: The URL including schema and hostname for the Cloudwatch monitoring server. This value will be used to specify the region - for example, to pull from us-east-1, the URL would be https://monitoring.us-east-1.amazonaws.com.

version.name: Description
version.value: The version of the Cloudwatch API to use.

collector.name: Description
collector.value: The collector(s) that are responsible for gathering the metrics

body_regexp.name: Description
body_regexp.value: This regular expression is matched against the body of the response. If a match is not found, the check will be marked as "bad.

ca_chain.name: Description
ca_chain.value: A path to a file containing all the certificate authorities that should be loaded to validate the remote certificate (for TLS checks)

certificate_file.name: Description
certificate_file.value: A path to a file containing the client certificate that will be presented to the remote server (for TLS-enabled checks)

ciphers.name: Description
ciphers.value: A list of ciphers to be used in the TLS protocol (for HTTPS checks)

code.name: Description
code.value: The HTTP code that is expected. If the code received does not match this regular expression, the check is marked as "bad."

extract.name: Description
extract.value: This regular expression is matched against the body of the response globally. The first capturing match is the key and the second capturing match is the value. Each key/value extracted is registered as a metric for the check.

headers.name: Description
headers.value: Map of HTTP Headers to send along with HTTP Requests

key_file.name: Description
key_file.value: A path to a file containing key to be used in conjunction with the cilent certificate (for TLS checks)

payload.name: Description
payload.value: The information transferred as the payload of an HTTP request

read_limit.name: Description
read_limit.value: Sets an approximate limit on the data read (0 means no limit)

url.name: Description
url.value: The URL to use as the target of the check

version.name: Description
version.value: Sets the HTTP version for the check to use

async_metrics.name: Description
async_metrics.value: Specify whether httptrap metrics are logged immediately or held until the status message is emitted

availability.name: Description
availability.value: The percentage of ICMP available required for the check to be considered "good."

count.name: Description
count.value: The number of ICMP requests to send during a single check.

interval.name: Description
interval.value: The number of milliseconds between ICMP requests.

ca_chain.name: Description
ca_chain.value: A path to a file containing all the certificate authorities that should be loaded to validate the remote certificate (for TLS checks)

certificate_file.name: Description
certificate_file.value: A path to a file containing the client certificate that will be presented to the remote server (for TLS-enabled checks)

ciphers.name: Description
ciphers.value: A list of ciphers to be used in the TLS protocol (for HTTPS checks)

headers.name: Description
headers.value: Map of HTTP Headers to send along with HTTP Requests

key_file.name: Description
key_file.value: A path to a file containing key to be used in conjunction with the cilent certificate (for TLS checks)

payload.name: Description
payload.value: The information transferred as the payload of an HTTP request

port.name: Description
port.value: Specifies the port on which the management interface can be reached

read_limit.name: Description
read_limit.value: Sets an approximate limit on the data read (0 means no limit)

url.name: Description
url.value: The URL to use as the target of the check

version.name: Description
version.value: Sets the HTTP version for the check to use

metric.name: Description
metric.value: Configuration for a stream of metrics

type.name: Description
type.value: Type of metric (e.g. numeric, histogram, text)

unit.name: Description
unit.value: The unit of measurement for a metric

metric_limit.name: Description
metric_limit.value: Setting a metric_limit will enable all (-1), disable (0), or allow up to the specified limit of metrics for this check ("N+", where N is a positive integer)

dsn.name: Description
dsn.value: The connect DSN for the MySQL instance

query.name: Description
query.value: The SQL to use as the query

name.name: Description
name.value: The name of the check bundle that will be displayed in the web interface

period.name: Description
period.value: The period between each time the check is made

dsn.name: Description
dsn.value: The connect DSN for the PostgreSQL instance

query.name: Description
query.value: The SQL to use as the query

tags.name: Description
tags.value: A list of tags assigned to the check

target.name: Description
target.value: The target of the check (e.g. hostname, URL, IP, etc)

banner_regexp.name: Description
banner_regexp.value: This regular expression is matched against the response banner. If a match is not found, the check will be marked as bad.

ca_chain.name: Description
ca_chain.value: A path to a file containing all the certificate authorities that should be loaded to validate the remote certificate (for TLS checks).

certificate_file.name: Description
certificate_file.value: A path to a file containing the client certificate that will be presented to the remote server (for TLS checks).

ciphers.name: Description
ciphers.value: A list of ciphers to be used when establishing a TLS connection

host.name: Description
host.value: Specifies the host name or IP address to connect to for this TCP check

key_file.name: Description
key_file.value: A path to a file containing key to be used in conjunction with the cilent certificate (for TLS checks)

port.name: Description
port.value: Specifies the port on which the management interface can be reached.

tls.name: Description
tls.value: Upgrade TCP connection to use TLS.

timeout.name: Description
timeout.value: The length of time in seconds (and fractions of a second) before the check will timeout if no response is returned to the collector

username.name: Description
username.value: Username Slackbot uses in Slack to deliver a notification

line_style.name: Description
line_style.value: How the line should change between point. A string containing either 'stepped', 'interpolated' or null.

type.name: Description
type.value: Type of metric (e.g. numeric, histogram, text)

unit.name: Description
unit.value: The unit of measurement for a metric

description.name: Description
description.value: A description of the metric cluster

id.name: Description
id.value: The ID of this metric cluster

name.name: Description
name.value: The name of the metric cluster

definition.name: Description
definition.value: A query to select a collection of metric streams

type.name: Description
type.value: The operation to perform on the matching metric streams

tags.name: Description
tags.value: A list of tags assigned to the metric cluster

check.name: Description
check.value: The CID of the check that contains the metric for this rule set

if.name: Description
if.value: A rule to execute for this rule set

then.name: Description
then.value: Description of the action(s) to take when this rule set is active

after.name: Description
after.value: The length of time we should wait before contacting the contact groups after this ruleset has faulted.

notify.name: Description
notify.value: List of contact groups to notify at the following appropriate severity if this rule set is active.

severity.name: Description
severity.value: Send a notification at this severity level.

value.name: Description
value.value: Predicate that the rule set uses to evaluate a stream of metrics

absent.name: Description
absent.value: Fire the rule set if there has been no data for the given metric stream over the last duration

changed.name: Description
changed.value: Boolean indicating the value has changed

contains.name: Description
contains.value: Fire the rule set if the text metric contain the following string

match.name: Description
match.value: Fire the rule set if the text metric exactly match the following string

max_value.name: Description
max_value.value: Fire the rule set if the numeric value is more than the specified value

min_value.name: Description
min_value.value: Fire the rule set if the numeric value less than the specified value

not_contain.name: Description
not_contain.value: Fire the rule set if the text metric does not contain the following string

not_match.name: Description
not_match.value: Fire the rule set if the text metric not match the following string

over.name: Description
over.value: Use a derived value using a window

last.name: Description
last.value: Duration over which data from the last interval is examined

using.name: Description
using.value: Define the window funciton to use over the last duration

link.name: Description
link.value: URL to show users when this rule set is active (e.g. wiki)

metric_name.name: Description
metric_name.value: The name of the metric stream within a check to register the rule set with

metric_type.name: Description
metric_type.value: The type of data flowing through the specified metric stream

parent.name: Description
parent.value: Parent CID that must be healthy for this rule set to be active

tags.name: Description
tags.value: Tags associated with this rule set

invites.name: Description
invites.value: Outstanding invites attached to the account

details.name: Description
details.value: Details associated with individual collectors (a.k.a. broker)
